Transform a spatial object to class geom

Source: R/gc_geom.R
gc_geom.Rd

Transform a spatial object to class geom

# S4 method for Spatial
gc_geom(input = NULL, window = NULL, ...)

# S4 method for sf
gc_geom(input = NULL, window = NULL, group = FALSE,
  ...)

# S4 method for ppp
gc_geom(input = NULL, window = NULL, ...)

Arguments

input

the object to transform to class geom.
window

[data.frame(1)]
the reference window of the new geom.
...

additional arguments.
group

[logical(1)]
should the attributes of multi* features be grouped, i.e. should the unique values per multi* feature be assigned into the groups table (TRUE), or should they be kept as duplicated per-feature attributes (FALSE, default)?

Value

an object of class geom

See also

Other spatial classes: gc_grob, gc_ppp, gc_sf, gc_sp

Examples

(geomPoly <- gc_geom(input = gtSF$polygon))
#> geom        polygon
#>             2 features | 15 vertices
#> crs         cartesian
#> attributes  (features) a
#> tiny map      12 
#>               ◯ ◌ ◌ ◉    
#>               ◌ ◌ ◌ ◌    
#>               ◌ ◌ ◌ ◌    
#>             0 ◉ ◌ ◌ ◯ 12 
#>               0 
(geomLine <- gc_geom(input = gtSP$SpatialLinesDataFrame))
#> geom        line
#>             2 features | 8 vertices
#> crs         cartesian
#> attributes  (features) a
#> tiny map      10 
#>               ◯ ◌ ◌ ◯    
#>               ◌ ◌ ◌ ◌    
#>               ◌ ◌ ◌ ◌    
#>             0 ◉ ◌ ◌ ◯ 10 
#>               0
